title: Ticket #4158: IPv6: mixed-mode command line tools
description:
The user-facing command line tools (condor_q, condor_status, etc) should be willing to accept IPv4 or IPv6 addresses where ever IP addresses or sinful strings are accepted. To the extent possible, they should ignore ENABLE_IPV6/ENABLE_IPV4 on the theory that if the user specifies a disabled protocol, they know what they're doing.

Brian Bockelman has a patch that improves how the tools handle mixed-mode IPv4/IPv6. Unfortunately Alan's simultaneous changes (forcing higher layer to explicitly specify IPv4 or IPv6 instead of using the global setting) rendered the patch no longer applicable. https://github.com/bbockelm/htcondor/commit/98041ff7e350026c07e8cdb7f501106a535bcf6f
creator: adesmet
